H0.text: Both plants and animals can be hosts for parasitic nematodes.

H1.text: Neither are nematodes parasites of plants, animals, or both.

H2.text: Animals can be hosts that nematodes parasitize.

H3.text: Plants can be parasitized by nematodes.

A4.text: Plant-parasitic nematodes include several groups causing severe crop losses, taking 10% of crops worldwide every year.

A5.text: Studies have shown that parasitic nematodes infect American eels, causing damage to the eel's swim bladder, dairy animals like cattle and buffalo, and all species of sheep.

A6.text: multiple varieties of nematodes have been found in the abdominal cavities of the primitively social sweat bee, Lasioglossum zephyrus.

A7.text: The golden nematode Globodera rostochiensis is a particularly harmful pest that has resulted in quarantines and crop failures worldwide.
